CatDescriptText: Mrs. Hattie Edwards, housewife, Homewood and Mr. George Thompson, trucker, East Pittsburgh, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1960, pg. 37 with question: "Do you think the religious issue will play a major role in the selection of the Democratic party's nominee for the Presidency of the United States?" Mrs. Hattie Edward's answer reads: "It really should because everybody is concerned with certain religious views.  The Catholics will go for him, and I think that if he is the candidate for President, even the Republican Catholics will vote for him."  Mr. George Thompson's answer reads: "In my opinion, the major issue is going to be the working man."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Hattie Edwards wearing dark short sleeved jacket with light colored diagonally striped fabric on lapels and cuffs, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of George Thompson wearing dark cap and moustache, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
